justification: The Methods section states: “participants answered a three-item cognitive reflection test (CRT) that measures analytic thinking by using problems with intuitively compelling but incorrect answers (averaged: 0 = Incorrect, 1 = Correct; Thomson & Oppenheimer, 2016).”

Under Psychological variables: “They also completed a three-item misplaced certainty scale, which assessed their tendency to feel certain about claims that are opposed by counter-evidence … (e.g., Gollwitzer et al., 2022).”

measured_by: 5-item Facebook-algorithm knowledge quiz / 4-item Digital literacy quiz
justification: For knowledge-based variables: “The first media literacy measure assessed participants’ knowledge of the Facebook algorithm… The second media literacy measure was a four-item digital literacy quiz… The two media literacy measures were combined into a single measure.”
Methods: “Political knowledge was measured using a four-item quiz on U.S. politics (e.g., ‘Whose responsibility is it to decide if a law is constitutional or not?’ … Tappin et al., 2021).”

measured_by: 4-item Social Media Use questionnaire (frequency, posting, minutes, news sourcing)
justification: Social media use: “We measured the quantity of social media use with four items… ‘How often are you on social media…’, ‘How often do you post…’, ‘…how many minutes…’, ‘…how often did you get news from social media…’. The overall quantity… was determined by averaging these four items.”
Demographics: “Education was assessed via a 7-point scale: ‘What is the highest level of education you have completed?’ (1 = High-School No Diploma … 7 = Professional Degree or Doctorate Degree).”

Demographics: “Political orientation was assessed using a 9-point Likert scale: ‘Where on the following scale of political orientation would you place yourself?’ (1 = Extremely Liberal … 9 = Extremely Conservative).”

Participant screening: “participants were asked in a pretest to rate how often they share news articles, ranging from 1 (never) to 5 (always)… only participants who responded 3 or above were invited to the study.”
